greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Matrix inverse of triangle A088956.
comment: For commuting lower unitriangular matrices A and B, we define A raised to the matrix power B, denoted A^^B, to be the matrix Exp(B*log(A)). Here Exp is the matrix exponential and the matrix logarithm Log(A) is defined as sum {n >= 1} (-1)^(n+1)*(A-1)^n/n. This triangle, call it M, is related to Pascal's triangle P by M^^M = P^(-1). Also M = P^(-1)^^A088956.
formula: E.g.f.: (x/T(x))*exp(t*x) = exp(-T(x))*exp(t*x) = 1 + (-1 + t)*x + (-1 - 2*t + t^2)*x^2/2! + ...., where T(x) := sum {n >= 0} n^(n-1) *x^n/n! denotes the tree function of A000169. The triangle is the exponential Riordan array [x/T(x),x] belonging to the exponential Appell group.

Let A(n,x) = x*(x+n)^(n-1) be an Abel polynomial. This is the triangle of connection constants expressing A(n,x) as a linear combination of the basis polynomials A(k,x+1), 0 <= k <= n. For example, A(4,x) = -27*A(0,x+1) - 16*A(1,x+1) - 6*A(2,x+1) - 4*A(3,x+1) + A(4,x+1) giving row 4 as [-27,-16,-6,-4,1].
mathematica: (* The function RiordanArray is defined in A256893. *)
results.author: _Peter Bala_, Sep 11 2012
